meanings.definition: To pull or haul (a vehicle, boat, etc.) behind another vehicle, using a rope, chain, or other device.
meanings.sent1: The car was towed by a truck.
meanings.sent2: The boat was towed to the dock by a speedboat.
meanings.sent3: The bicycle towed the wagon full of toys down the hill.
meanings.sent4: The determined ant towed the heavy leaf across the ground.
meanings.sent5: The strong horse towed the fallen tree out of the way.

meanings.definition: To be pulled or hauled behind another vehicle.
meanings.sent1: The sled was towed by the snowmobile.
meanings.sent2: The broken-down car was towed to the mechanic.
meanings.sent3: The kite towed the child along the beach on a windy day.
meanings.sent4: The river current towed the raft downstream swiftly.
meanings.sent5: The tractor towed the trailer filled with hay across the farm.

meanings.sent1: Yesterday, the car was towed to the repair shop.
meanings.sent2: The boat was towed back to shore after the storm.
meanings.sent3: The truck towed the broken-down car to the junkyard.
meanings.sent4: The towed vehicle arrived safely at its destination.
meanings.sent5: The towed trailer carried all the camping gear for the trip.
